sen.j: 甘露寺 国長（かんろじ くになが、明和8年9月10日 (旧暦)（1771年10月17日） - 天保8年6月18日 (旧暦)（1837年7月20日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Kuninaga KANROJI (born on October 17, 1771 and passed away on July 20, 1837) was a court noble of the late Edo period.
Kuninaga KANROJI (October 17, 1771 - July 20, 1837) was a Kugyo (court noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 生没年の書き方を他のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Kuninaga KANROJI (October 17, 1771 - July 20, 1837) was a Kugyo (court noble) in the late Edo period.

sen.cmt: 篤長の読みが確認できませんでした。
甘露寺篤長は「かんろじかずなが」です。http://www1.parkcity.ne.jp/sito/k69.html

sen.j: 正室は関長誠の娘、継室は冷泉為章の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Chosei SEKI's daughter and his second wife was Tameaki REIZEI's daugher.
sen.cmt: 関長誠, 冷泉為章の読みが確認できませんでした。
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Naganobu SEKI and second wife was a daughter of Tamefumi REIZEI.
sen.cmt: 関長誠（せきながのぶ）http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%96%A2%E9%95%B7%E8%AA%A0冷泉為章（れいぜいためふみ）http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%86%B7%E6%B3%89%E7%82%BA%E7%AB%A0
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Naganobu SEKI and second wife was a daughter of Tamefumi REIZEI.

sen.j: 子に甘露寺治長、甘露寺愛長、竹内惟和室、小倉輔季、養女（二条治孝の娘、鍋島直正養女、鍋島直與室）、甘露寺妍子（仁孝天皇典侍）がいた。
sen.e: His sons were Harunaga KANROJI, Ainaga KANJORI, and Yusuke OGURA; one of his daughters married Korekazu TAKEUCHI and the other daughter, Kiyoko KANROJI, was Emperor Ninko's Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank); he also had an adopted daughter, who was Harutaka NIJO's daughter and adopted to Naomasa NABESHIMA and married Naosuke NABESHIMA.
sen.cmt: 治長,愛長,竹内惟和,小倉輔季, 鍋島直與の読みが確認できませんでした。 また「養女」が甘露寺国長と鍋島直正の養女になった順を確認できなかったため、曖昧な文になっております。
sen.e: His sons were Harunaga KANROJI, Narunaga KANJORI, and Sukesue OGURA; one of his daughters married Korekazu TAKENOUCHI and another daughter, Kiyoko KANROJI, was Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) of Emperor Ninko; he also had an adopted daughter, a daughter of Harutaka NIJO who was later adopted by Naomasa NABESHIMA and married Naotomo NABESHIMA.
sen.cmt: 甘露寺治長：かんろじはるなが甘露寺愛長：かんろじなるなが竹内惟和：たけのうちこれかず小倉輔季：おぐらすけすえ鍋島直與：なべしまなおとも
sen.e: His sons were Harunaga KANROJI, Narunaga KANJORI, and Sukesue OGURA; one of his daughters married Korekazu TAKENOUCHI and another daughter, Kiyoko KANROJI, was Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) of Emperor Ninko; he also had an adopted daughter, a daughter of Harutaka NIJO who was later adopted by Naomasa NABESHIMA and married Naotomo NABESHIMA.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)10年（1813年）加茂下上社伝奏、文化11年（1814年）正二位権大納言、文政2年（1819年）これを辞する。
sen.e: In 1813, Kuninaga was appointed to Denso (job title to relay messages of court's people to Emperor) of Kamo-Shimokamisha, and in 1814, to Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Chief Councilor of State), which he resigned in 1819.
sen.cmt: 加茂下上社の定訳並びに読みが確認できませんでした。 また「文化 (元号)10年（1813年）加茂下上社伝奏、文化11年（1814年）正二位権大納言」とあるのは、上記を与えられた、と判断し、「これを辞す」となるのは、「正二位権大納言」を辞した、と判断しました。
sen.e: In 1813, Kuninaga was appointed to Kamo Denso (Kamo-jinja Shrine messenger to Emperor) for both Shimogamo and Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, and in 1814, he was promoted to Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Chief Councilor of State), which he resigned in 1819.
sen.cmt: 加茂下上社伝奏は用語集の「賀茂伝奏」に当たると解釈し、下賀茂神社、上賀茂神社両方を担当していると考え、trans1を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1813, Kuninaga was appointed to Kamo Denso (Kamo-jinja Shrine messenger to Emperor) for both Shimogamo and Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, and in 1814, he was promoted to Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Chief Councilor of State), which he resigned in 1819.

sen.j: 文政5年（1822年）武家伝奏、文政7年（1824年）従一位、天保7年（1836年）武家伝奏を辞任する。
sen.e: He was appointed to Buke Tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government) in 1822 and to Juichii (Junior First Rank) in 1824; he resigned Buke Tenso in 1836.
sen.cmt: 「文政5年（1822年）武家伝奏、文政7年（1824年）従一位」とあるのは、上記を与えられた、と判断しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to Buke Tenso (liaison officers between the Imperial Court and the military government) in 1822 and to Juichii (Junior First Rank) in 1824; he resigned Buke Tenso in 1836.
He was appointed to Buke Tenso (liaison officers between the Imperial Court and the military government) in 1822 and to Juichii (Junior First Rank) in 1824; he resigned Buke Tenso in 1836.
